intro: Amyema sanguinea, commonly known as the red-stemmed amyema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly rough texture. Amyema sanguinea is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
